/* History */ Chg "nonfundamentalists" to "non-fundamentalists" for easier reading of a long word; Chg "such" to "fundamental" - fundamental must be repeated because "such" refers to most recent noun
/* Origins and Development of the term */ Chg "Fosdick" to "that he" - Rule: Do not use the same proper noun twice in the same sentence.
/* Origins and Development of the term */ Chg "people like Harry" to "people such as Harry" - not everyone likes Harry! ;-)
/* Origins and Development of the term */ Chg "of calling it" to "of referring to it as" - Rule: Do not use the same word twice in the same sentence
/* Origins and Development of the term */ Chg "non-Christian" to "naturalistic" - to effect agreement of terms in the two sentences; Removed "themselves" - unnecessary word
/* Origins and Development of the term */ Chg "fundamentalists and modernists" to italic; Chg "viewed this struggle" to "viewed this" - Rule: Do not use the same word twice in the same sentence
/* Origins and Development of the term */ Chg "fundamentalist" to italics; Chg "Baptist Watchman-Examiner" to bold; Chg "Through the 1920s" to "Throughout"
/* Origins and Development of the term */ "Examples of" rewrote sentence for easier reading; Chg "but above all" to "and above all"
/* Origins and Development of the term */ "all considered basic to the Christian Faith" set apart by parentheses instead of commas - ease of reading complex sentence
/* Origins and Development of the term */ Chg "initiating" to "resulted" - wording; Chg "identification of" to "identification and listing of" - the Fundamentals are a list that results from I.D.
/* Origins and Development of the term */ Change "It spread from there" to "It soon spread" - wording; ""-isms" it" added "which"; Changed "four phases" to "several phases" - phases unnumbered
